alert.note: Alert for Lee; Pontotoc; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 9:03PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Union, northeastern Pontotoc and Lee Counties through 930 PM CST... At 903 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Trace State Park, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tupelo, Pontotoc, Verona, Trace State Park, Tombigbee State Park, Saltillo, Shannon, Plantersville, Ecru, Troy, Furrs, Sherman, Algoma, Blue Springs, Endville, Cherry Creek, Chiwapa, Mooreville, Eggville and Flowerdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern Mississippi.
